question_sentence: The mayor of Barcelona announced plans to ban what from the city by 2028?
evidence: Mayor Jaume Collboni says he will refuse to renew licences for the 10,100 properties in Barcelona currently approved for listing on Airbnb, as part of a wider push to reduce over-tourism and prevent locals from being priced out of housing.

question_sentence: The Vatican put Italian Archbishop Carlo Maria Viganò on trial accused of what crime?
evidence: Archbishop Viganò, a former Vatican ambassador to the US, is on trial for the "crime of schism" and "denial of the legitimacy of Pope Francis" after he denounced the Pope in increasingly harsh terms — referring to him as a liberal "servant of Satan".

question_sentence: Julian Assange walked free following a court hearing in which US Pacific territory?
evidence: The islands, a US commonwealth territory, were chosen to host the Assange hearing partly due to their relative proximity to Australia, where Assange's wife and their two children were waiting to celebrate his release.

question_sentence: What did US Surgeon General Vivek Murthy declare as an urgent public health crisis?
evidence: The US Surgeon General has urged the nation to address the physical and psychological harms of gun violence with the same tools and intensity used to promote quitting smoking, seat belt use, and other nonpartisan public health interventions. More than 48,000 Americans died from firearms injuries in 2022, the latest data shows.

question_sentence: A "transformative" gene therapy drug called Hemgenix was approved by the NHS to treat which condition?
evidence: A clinical trial showed that an infusion of the gene therapy drug Hemgenix can remove the need for weekly injections of blood-clotting enzymes. It will now be offered to some of the 2,000 people in the UK living with the condition.

question_sentence: Hundreds of Kenyan police officers arrived in Haiti’s capital to launch what mission?
evidence: The 400 Kenyan police officers constitute the first wave of an expected 2,500-person law enforcement initiative authorised by the UN to combat gang violence. The mission is the "fourth major foreign military intervention in Haiti" since 1915.

question_sentence: Dozens of people died after drinking bootleg alcohol in which Indian state?
evidence: Contaminated bootleg alcohol is a recurring problem in India, particularly in states where the sale of alcohol is restricted or banned. Drinkers in Tamil Nadu can only buy alcohol at state off-licences, creating a black market for cheaper but unregulated spirits.

question_sentence: The US Supreme Court will hear arguments challenging a law restricting gender-affirming care for transgender minors in which state?
evidence: The Supreme Court announced it will review a Biden-backed challenge to a Tennessee law restricting puberty blockers and hormone therapy for transgender minors, even with parental permission. Hearings are expected to commence in the autumn, with a decision anticipated by next summer.

question_sentence: A new study suggested that people who live near what may be at a higher risk of diabetes, high blood pressure and dementia?
evidence: The increased risk, reported by a study commissioned by campaign group Transport and Environment, is thought to be linked to ultrafine air pollution particles emitted by planes. Find out more on this week's episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Bolivian military commander General Juan José Zúñiga was arrested for allegedly committing what crime?
evidence: Zúñiga was arrested after he led soldiers and armoured vehicles into La Paz's central Plaza Murillo and tried to occupy the presidential palace. But the soldiers pulled back after a newly installed army commander ordered them to return to their barracks.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump met for their first 2024 debate this week. Where did the showdown occur?
evidence: The historic debate at CNN’s Atlanta studios marked the first time a sitting president and an ex-president faced off before millions of viewers.

question_sentence: Which US dam is in “imminent failure condition” after intense flooding hit the Midwest?
evidence: Officials have warned that the Rapidan Dam located about 70 miles southwest of Minneapolis is in "imminent failure condition." Assessment and response efforts are underway as the area has seen significant damage and loss of infrastructure and property.

question_sentence: A growing list of school districts in the US are moving to ban which item from classrooms?
evidence: Districts across the country are moving to ban students from using cell phones during the school day. New York City Public Schools — the nation's largest district with around 1 million students — could ban cell phones by January. The Los Angeles Unified School District also announced plans to ban cell phones as early as 2025.

question_sentence: Which country recently loaned the US two giant pandas?
evidence: Two giant pandas from China are headed to the San Diego Zoo. China loans pandas to select countries under a program often referred to as “panda diplomacy” to display warming relations between nations. It is the first time the US has received a panda loan from China in more than 20 years.

question_sentence: A mysterious monolith was discovered in a mountain range outside of Las Vegas, prompting theories of alien life. What was the object made of?
evidence: A massive monolith made of reflective sheet metal was found jutting out of the rocks in a remote area near Las Vegas. Authorities have removed the structure — but how it got there is still unsolved.

question_sentence: Which dessert food was impacted by a widespread recall this week due to possible listeria contamination?
evidence: Ice cream products from over a dozen brands including Friendly’s and Hershey’s were recalled over bacterial contamination concerns

question_sentence: Which airline is being investigated after two of its planes recently plunged midflight?
evidence: The FAA is investigating a Southwest flight that flew nearly 500 feet above an Oklahoma town, triggering an altitude warning from air traffic control. It is the second recent incident involving a Southwest plane narrowly missing the ground after another flight this month came within 400 feet of crashing into the ocean.

question_sentence: Which country in South America was rocked by an attempted military coup?
evidence: An attempted coup in Bolivia failed Wednesday after President Luis Arce called on the public to mobilize in defense of democracy.

question_sentence: Which controversial figure was released from prison this week?
evidence: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange walked free after his 12-year battle against extradition to the US ended in a plea deal. Federal officials pursued Assange after his whistleblowing website published nearly half a million secret military documents relating to the US wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.

question_sentence: Which NHL team captured its first Stanley Cup in franchise history?
evidence: The Florida Panthers won their first NHL championship on Monday after defeating the Edmonton Oilers in a thrilling Game 7.
